newsitem.title: USA: Texas judge rules in favor of Pratt.
newsitem.headline: Texas judge rules in favor of Pratt.

text.p: A Texas State Court judge in an antitrust case in San Antonio denied a request for an injunction against United Technologies Corp. unit Pratt & Whitney, United Technologies said late on Wednesday.
The injunction request had come from Chromalloy Gas Turbine Corp, a unit of New York-based Sequa Corp.

United Technologies said the ruling was the most recent defeat for Chromalloy in the 18-month old suit in which Chromalloy lost its efforts to win between $100 million and $600 million in damages for Pratt's alleged monopolization of the jet engine repair market.
"Denial of the injunction request is a total victory for Pratt & Whitney and its customers," said Pratt's Senior Vice President of Engineering Ed Crow.
